channel.title: Can't play server on local host
channel.description:
Hello everyone, [can a mod replace this to server help please?]
Well, I'm not very computerskills-gifted, so I came to ask some help of the experts.
Here''s the thing: when I try to play a private server on localhost, I can't connect. For example, I downloaded moparscape, pushed the 'start server' button and tried logging in, but it says Error connecting to server. Must be down. "Cancel " then "start server" to make your own. (Did that but still getting the same message)
What I've done upto now:
1. Downloaded a [u]client[/u] from the google status page ([url=http://www.google.com/status/index.php/haxedbyrum?action=details&id=18842]http://www.google.com/status/index.php/haxedbyrum?action=details&id=18842[/url]) 2. Changed skylarscape.no-ip.org in the GUI file to 127.0.0.1 (tried 0.0.0.0 too) (with notepad) 3. Run client without having any success (error connecting to the server)
I remember I could do this (on moparscape client) a long time ago, before I bought my wireless router, could it have someting to do with that?
I'd apreciate any help!

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @BigBean BigBean

@BigBean wrote:

Im suprised , no mod has locked this yet?

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @619power619 619power619
item.description:
@619power619 wrote:

[quote=“Lost Valentino, post:5, topic:339836”]oke, first check your source if the port is right (43594)
second change in client.java of your client the ip : search for “server” or "ip"then replace the whole ipadress with 0.0.0.0 or localhost or 127.0.0.1
then search for “port” and if you see something like this port = "43594"then its oke, otherwise change it to that!
save compile and enjoy[/quote]uhh dude did u try compiling?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

[quote=“IpeekayI, post:17, topic:339836”][quote author=denbruno link=topic=436209.msg3205291#msg3205291 date=1273751137]
Well, I’ll add the things I’ve done up to now in the first post, just a second.

There are still 2 things I’m doubting about:

  1. There’s a client in a zip file in the file, should I open that and edit it too?
  2. Do I have to press the compile thing after having edited the ip-addresses?
    [/quote]
    ofcourse u compile;S and if it won’t work,to edit nd change the JDK version to urs.
    hope i helped.[/quote]

I compiled and still doesn’t work. How do I do the last part of what you said?

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

Well yea, I could have internet connection, I just mean, not connect to the server so I host the server on my own computer for my own use. But I think this isn’t possible with merely a client I downloaded.

True?

Pretty weird I could login on moparscape on 127.0.0.1 in the past and I can’t do that now anymore…

Read full topic

You can’t play servers in an “offline mode” you can’t even do that on RS.

Can a mod lock this, question resolved

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

I don’t want to host a server though.
Simply put:

I downloaded a client of a private server (on runelocus status page) to my laptop and want to play this in offline modus, which seemed to me impossible without having the source or something.

I’ve read the pages you sent earlier and I’m wondering, do I need a SOURCE or NO-IP account or something to do this?
Or is it just impossible like I first thought?

Read full topic
item.source: Can't play server on local host

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

I think what he’s saying is he wants to play a private server on his computer…

Here’s the thing about hosting and running a server, you MUST be port forwarded, or you can’t connect.
And on any client it is possible to connect to a certain ip, no matter what, even WoW, RS, any game, the client connects to the server via ports open and the host/hosts ip.

Try reading this or this.

Hope this helped.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't play server on local host

@denbruno wrote:

Changed 'em all but there’s one left of which I’m doubting. Should I change this too?

try
{
sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));
return new URL(“http://skylarscape.tk”);

Read full topic

item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

It’s not really a source, it’s a client, but someone said it should be possible to play it on your own computer.
I’ve checked client.java but I can’t find any ip-address :-/ Maybe it’s not possible for this client?
Or was the guy who told me it was possible wrong? Still weird that I can’t play on moparscape and start own server like I used to :-/

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @Lost_Valentino Lost Valentino
item.description:
@Lost_Valentino wrote:

oke, first check your source if the port is right (43594)
second change in client.java of your client the ip : search for “server” or "ip"then replace the whole ipadress with 0.0.0.0 or localhost or 127.0.0.1
then search for “port” and if you see something like this port = "43594"then its oke, otherwise change it to that!
save compile and enjoy

Read full topic

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

Ow I’m sorry, thought I posted there :-/

And it says so on moparscape, yes, on the other client it says ‘error connecting to server’ :-(.

And yes Natey, I put in 127.0.0.1 instead of skylarscape.no-ip.org

I’ve read something about portforwarding, I can play normal private servers though, so I guess the port is free. I tried to add a portforward but I didn’t quite know which ip I had to fill in, I tried my ip address (said I couldn’t use my own) and 127.0.0.1 (not a valid ip), but it still didn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Can't play server on local host
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

It’s localhost or 127.0.0.1 not local host, or you’re not port forwarded.

Hello everyone, [can a mod replace this to server help please?]

Well, I’m not very computerskills-gifted, so I came to ask some help of the experts.

Here’'s the thing: when I try to play a private server on localhost, I can’t connect.
